addMoveChain

protected void addMoveChain(int rowChange,
                            int columnChange,
                            byte movesToGenerate)
Utility function that adds a chain of moves that this piece can do

Parameters:
rowChange - the increment(positive)/decrement(negative) for each step
columnChange - the increment(right)/decrement(left) for each step
movesToGenerate - number of moves to generate

addPossibleMoves

public abstract void addPossibleMoves()
Add the theoretically possible moves for this piece to the internal move list for this piece (Automatically called from the constructor)

getPossibleMoves

public java.util.ArrayList<Move> getPossibleMoves()
Returns:
a list of "in theory" possible moves that this piece can make

getAvailableMoves

public java.util.List<Move> getAvailableMoves(boolean sort,
                                              ChessBoard board)
Returns the cached evaluation of all the possible moves for this piece and excludes the ones that aren't possible at the moment Override this method if you want to optimize it for a specific piece

Parameters:
sort - true if the returned map should be ordered by the moves take over value
board -
Returns:
the available moves for this piece on the supplied board and within it's bounds ordered by their take over value

getNonAvailableMoves

public java.util.List<Move> getNonAvailableMoves(ChessBoard board)
Returns the cached evaluation of all the possible moves for this piece and excludes the ones that are possible at the moment Override this method if you want to optimize it for a specific piece

Parameters:
board -
Returns:
the non available moves for this piece on the supplied board and within it's bounds ordered by their take over value
